website_summaries.verdict: A no-fuss option for fast and effective 3D scanning.
pros: Looks like a record player, yet scans like a dream
Unlike other brands, it has the ability to scale the size of 3D scans with ancillary products
Arrives with reference guides including YouTube tutorials
cons: Can feel flimsy to some customers, however most are impressed with the overall design and results

website_summaries.verdict: The laser-based Matter and Form 3D Scanner is a good companion for a 3D printer.
pros: Saves scans in several useful formats
Mostly good scan results in testing
cons: Some test scans showed significant detail loss

customer_reviews.title: Can't get better than this
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding performance. Simple to use. This is the one to get. Never used a 3D scanner before. I did some reading and some learning. I learned that lighting is important. Background is important (flat black foam board worked for me) and combining 2 or more scans is important. My results on the first day are shown in the image. The image on the left is the original figurine I wanted to scan, the image on the right is the final combined scan (3 scans) converted to a mesh. Can't get better than this, in my opinion. Todd
customer_reviews.author: Todd Wessendorf

customer_reviews.title: This is a great scanner and will do most scanning you need
customer_reviews.text: After buying my 3d Matter and form scanner i was invited to tutorial session online by them which helped me learn more advanced features of this scanner.This is a great scanner and will do most scanning you need. The customer service is great. as i said they invited me to an advanced session but i was totally pleased with the scanner before that.I was also given an invitation to call or get in touch with them at any time. I am very well pleased with the product and the customer service. Thanks, Gary
customer_reviews.author: G. Reid

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! Scan several times at least.
customer_reviews.text: It works! The most important thing of a 3D scanner is it can really scan a thing over 95% of the original. The 5% is because I need to smooth the surface by other software but not much work and it is expected. I thought the quality scanned out was bad at first but scan over 5 times and after mesh build up, the thing scanned come out with surprise, I can see it on screen in 3D. After surface smooth by software, 3D printed, the copy almost same as the original. Great! Advise, I use a lightbox without light and a black backdrop to keep the background constant. No bright environment needed, instead, keep little dark better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality for the price, but with a learning curve.
customer_reviews.text: Got this scanner with some preconceptions of how it was supposed to work. When I first set it up and played around with it, my results were very lack luster. I sat up a call with the company to do a free training session. Got some great tips and my last few scans have been much much better. If you have a model with a lot of definition and intricate parts, it may not get them all. But some work will get you something very close to the object at hand. Plan on working some more with this and see what I can get done
customer_reviews.author: Jason Kittrell

customer_reviews.title: Nice price pont, but medicore results
customer_reviews.text: This is the only product I've found in a decent price point for 3d scanning, but needs a lot of improvement. Very slow scanning and requires a lot of tinkering to get a decent scan. Expect to scan at least 2 or more times and then combine the scans using the software that come with the scanner. I've only had one successful scan and I'm working on another now, but getting very fustrated with the results.
customer_reviews.author: RDesilets

customer_reviews.title: They have great tech support and they are more than willing to ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking at scanning small items you might want to check with the manufacture. They have great tech support and they are more than willing to help you with issues and also training. I was looking to scan some miniatures that are about an inch tall and have a lot of detail and it is not the best for those types of scans. They are coming out with new software soon and I hope that will help.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Kobe

customer_reviews.title: The Matter and Form Scanner is Easy to Set UP and Use
customer_reviews.text: I have no dislikes for the scanner. There is a lot to learn to be able to use the scanner effectively. Once learned however the actual use is very easy. The Quick Scan is a must. The regular scan can take hours. The Quick Scan minutes. The lighter the object being scanned the better the results. I use hair spray and flour on my subjects. Most of my scanning is of miniature Civil War figures of various sizes. They vary in height from two inches to seven inches. All size scan well and the detail is good.
customer_reviews.author: DogMom

customer_reviews.title: and doesn't always look the best before clean up
customer_reviews.text: The scanner works well if you scan items that are not reflective or have a lot of areas not visible to the camera and laser. Lighting is the key to using the scanner. I placed two white led strips on the sides behind the camera, and I had no problems with setup or scans. Only noise it makes is when the camera is raised or lowered. Scanning will take time, and doesn't always look the best before clean up. I would have gave 5 stars if they would have included a lighting system on the scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: The scanner can not scan anything with a pocket in ...
customer_reviews.text: The scanner can not scan anything with a pocket in it. It can only scan a solid part if the part has a hole, it converts the hole into a solid or a bunch of spatial prints. This is very frustrating. I am trying to get feedback from the manufacturer so hopefully I can upgrade my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: chrisP

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner for any classroom or home schooling program
customer_reviews.text: Compact, lightweight, and portable. Great Scanner for any classroom or home schooling program. Customer Support is fantastic for this company, especially through the chat option. I had to return the first scanner that we received, due to a mechanical malfunction, but the manufacturer was great with keeping me informed on the product status. Thank you to Lauren, Alex, and crew! Works great with the 3-D printer also by New Matter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple set up and use straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Worked straight out of the box with minimum fuss. Setup was simplicity itself. I tested on the frog provided and a model tank. With the basic settings it produced acceptable results, and on fixed rotation scan it produced fine detail, albeit a time-consuming exercise! Meshing fills any holes and tidies things up. The main thing appears to be getting the light level right - not too bright or directional.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Only issue is when I scan something it is not giving me a complete scan. I have tried different backgrounds and so far I have found that a cardboard box works the best. I tried it on my workbench and it was terrible and distorted so I ;put it in a box and at least now I somewhat can tell what I am scanning.
customer_reviews.author: Ravenclaw123

customer_reviews.title: I was contacted by the Matter and Form team with an offer for a free tutorial on how to use the scanner as well as tips and tric
customer_reviews.text: Although I am new to 3D scanning, I was contacted by the Matter and Form team with an offer for a free tutorial on how to use the scanner as well as tips and tricks to get the best quality scans. It was very helpful, and showed me that they really do care about putting out a good product and having good customer support. The tutor walked me through step by step and answered every question I had for him. I'm glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod Pharr

customer_reviews.title: "A" for effort
customer_reviews.text: While this is an impressive item, it is not yet ready for practical use in my opinion. I'm sure it is no easy feat to execute such a technically advanced product at a reasonable cost. However, more development is needed before you will be able to use this machine to get anything done. I returned mine. If you're not ready to spend an arm and a leg, i.e. $5,000 or more, on a capable machine, I say hold off on buying anyone's 3D scanner until the cost of the capable machines comes down to affordable levels.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: I do like the integrated turntable - Part rotation is one step ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall OK. I have found it loud and very slow but everything works as advertised. It is portable and works right out of the box. I do like the integrated turntable - Part rotation is one step that is difficult to do well manually. Look at the David starter kit as an option. It is faster, the SW is better but it is not as portable and there is no turntable.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: not the brightest under the stars.....
customer_reviews.text: kind of works but is not very rough scans....do not expect any help from the technical support. Yes they do contact but it takes for ever to get an answer.Even so i send them pictures...logs.....and scan files they hardly gave me technical information on what to do...you are on your own.
customer_reviews.author: KUP L.

customer_reviews.title: Needs work
customer_reviews.text: I don't think this product is ready for prime time. It's close but not quite. I'd love to be able to return it and repurchase next year. So far, it takes more time to clean up the frog scan than it takes to scan the frog. Also, the frog is the only thing that didn't turn out looking like just a blob. The frog, by the way, is something provided with the scanner as a demo.
customer_reviews.author: My Public Name

customer_reviews.title: Highly confident great results will follow... Stay tuned...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent customer service... After reporting an issue, I was promptly and kindly contacted back and a rapid remedy was implemented... Highly confident great results will follow... I will update on my actual scanning results ASAP, please stay tuned...
customer_reviews.author: Thunder-Blizzard-Lab

customer_reviews.title: not easy fuzzy scans
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is hard to use, and you have to pay for the good upgraded software I tried everything even had a professional 3d tech professor from the college in our town try to get this to work and he even said it was difficult and he couldnt even get it to scan well , it takes a long time also. spend a extra $500 and get a good scanner
customer_reviews.author: Jay Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Dial down the lights
customer_reviews.text: Had an issue with the lighting and wasn't getting the correct amount or having too much of light. Found the light required to make it possible
customer_reviews.author: Ian Frost

customer_reviews.title: great company
customer_reviews.text: well built scanner and the best customer service i have ever seen. thanks matter and form!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: SUPER!
customer_reviews.text: Turned it on, followed simple instructions, made a really high detail .stl easily. I will use models from this thing for scientific research, and I can already tell they are up to the task. Check out the model, it speaks for itself!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Zaneveld

customer_reviews.title: I got the scanner on Monday and found it easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This is my first product review ever on Amazon. I got the scanner on Monday and found it easy to set up, easy to calibrate and easy to scan objects and then convert the files into files that can be read by my 3D printers. So far, it is performing better than I'd expected/hoped.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Paper Weight
customer_reviews.text: Will not calibrate to any usable resolution. Expensive paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: Motorsports Product Group LLC

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: They give a frog as test sample to scan.... It can't even scan that correctly.... Junk do not waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great Intro to 3D Scanning
customer_reviews.text: The best 3D scanner available at this price point. Learning curve is a bit steep, but the company offers lots of online tutorials.
customer_reviews.author: MasterSki34

customer_reviews.title: Alright but not as good as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: As long as I'm not trying to scan something with a hole in it everything works alright. I've yet to get a really good detailed model from it but at least I can get close and edit them myself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Came nicely packaged, great design and concept
customer_reviews.text: Tried to scan several items, never did get one. Came nicely packaged, great design and concept, very poor instructions/guidance.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Once we got the hang of it it works great
customer_reviews.author: S. Meleo

customer_reviews.title: Fair so far
customer_reviews.text: Still working with it. Does not do bowels or hinges with holes in them. Works best on solid objects. Still experimenting on different things
customer_reviews.author: michael Beaver

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this, i was considering the Matter Hackers 3d Scanner but this one was cheaper and had better reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.text: Returned it. I expected MUCH better scan quality. Scans were passable tried everything M&F suggested. Would be neat for a kid, not usable for anything more honestly.
customer_reviews.author: robbie

customer_reviews.title: The scanner is very cool but customer service with this company is pathetic and ...
customer_reviews.text: The scanner is very cool but customer service with this company is pathetic and even though they list supporting Windows 32 Bit, after trying on several terminals I could not get it to work and was forced to buy a Mac to finish our project on time because it took them 8 days to even offer a quality assurance technician. The device itself works really great on a 64 bit Mac system (havent seen it work with a Windows system yet). Its also quite a bit slower than they say on their site but who cares its better than manually trying to model the object. I dont know if I would buy from this manufacturer again.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Vallens

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves it!!!! He has really kept it and his 3D printer working!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Butler

customer_reviews.title: BEST EASY TO USE SCANNER EVER! GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this scanner after reviewing several other scanners and I love this thing. Initially I had an issue with the first scanner, but working with customer service and then working with one of the owners and developers of this scanner, they found a defect and sent a FedEx label for me to ship the scanner back and replaced it with another, NO HASSLES. WONDERFUL CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! The scanner is easy to use, and does require a little fine tuning to scan your particular items, but it's really easy to figure out. The interfacing software is a breeze to work with. KUDOS TO MATTER AND FORM. They really made a extremely fine scanner. BEST IN CLASS!!
customer_reviews.author: JAMES M UNRUH

customer_reviews.title: sad.
customer_reviews.text: Ive worked with it for 2 weeks.cannot get a decent scan tried shiny,dull white,black,small,big,even put a part in flour to coat it.got best scan from powder coating the item and using manual settings.i dont like the harsh grinding it produces during calibration.considering returning it.and usung a kinect.also the tech support and firums are weak.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Beware.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it, used it about three times, then resold it on eBay. Doesn't scan objects that aren't superbly flat-surfaced. The best scan I got was a mini scale Incredible Hulk MIGHTY MUGG vinyl figure. Maybe I wasn't using it right, but I didn't like the experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy as the description lead me to believe.
customer_reviews.text: I find the description very misleading at best. The scans it produces are crude at best and you have to spend significant time cleaning it up in order to get anything halfway decent. Reminds of the initial 2D scanners back in the 90's, very slow and crude producing low quality pictures. I'm sending this back.
customer_reviews.author: Siggi Bjarnason

customer_reviews.title: Needed the absolute best lighting and contrast to complete an OK scan
customer_reviews.text: Needed the absolute best lighting and contrast to complete an OK scan. If there is any shine on a object or it is black, it has a very hard time catching anything. Very cheap looking and makes a lot of noise. Hope they design it better in the future. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: NOT WHAT THEY DESCRIBE
customer_reviews.text: AFTER FEW DAYS OF TRYING NOT EVEN ONE SCAN WAS CLOSE TO WHAT THEY DESCRIBE. I WAS TRYING IN MULTIPLE LIGHT CONDITIONS AND EVERY TIME END UP WITH SOME UNRECOGNIZED SCAN.
customer_reviews.author: PL

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hassle
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product arrived broken replacement was broken also I would look elsewhere you might get a good one but then again you might get two bad ones like I did not worth the hassle
customer_reviews.author: Hacksaw

customer_reviews.title: Great right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Great right out of the box! However it becomes a greater tool when using the Advanced settings!! Also customer support is top notch! They offer online Webex sessions to clear up questions and concerns!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hajdik

customer_reviews.title: Far too difficult to get the lighting and background setup ...
customer_reviews.text: Far too difficult to get the lighting and background setup. I need something fast and accurate. The spindle sounds if it is going to fall apart any moment.
customer_reviews.author: 500 Projects LLC

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Very cool product design, but the scans are unusable. Waste of time for me at least.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Blair

customer_reviews.title: Produced double walled scans.  Skip if you need a plug and play system.
customer_reviews.text: Not a finished product. The unit doesn't create usable scans. My issue was a double walled point cloud that made scans unusable. Support was friendly but slow and ultimately I returned the product for the David scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Bug Robotics

customer_reviews.title: I bought it thinking I could use it for 3d prints, and couldn't even scan once. FAIL
customer_reviews.text: You can tweak, and tweak, and tweak some more, but I would defy anyone, pro or dedicated amature to get a halfway decent scan. This truly does not work as good as advertised, I am returning based on a complete lack of usable quality. Don't even think about 3d printing with the scans you get, unless you are a 3d artist like me, you might find it a tad difficult. Based on the quality and performance of the scanner. One star.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse David

customer_reviews.title: This is a toy, not a serious scanner in the least.
customer_reviews.text: This is simply just a toy. It can only do a limited range of scans, mostly of objects over 3" in dia and nothing reflective or even glossy. The scans take a VERY long time to complete and after trying for a week of scanning multiple small child's toy objects, I was still not able to get a single STL mesh that was viable for printing. Calibration is hit or miss, though it will tell you it's calibrated most every time, the quality of output varies hugely. It's just a toy like I said, not for any kind of serious 3d scanning at all.
customer_reviews.author: Gary A. Martin

customer_reviews.title: mr.mislead
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry but it did not meet our expectations. The youtube video is very misleading that you can perform almost anything from the minimum to maximum size......forget about jewelry ,even with us powder coating the object it is a very rough image at best and non usable .the invented evedentallly has the perfect excuse that these can be performed . easily. Also there is a no return policy that you should read before buying it ,as I wanted to return it the next day. I will not recommended this machine to anyone.it is a toy at best .the inventor is misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: worthless, could not get a decent scan, sent it back
customer_reviews.author: Nathane Gray

product_meta.title: Matter and Form MFS1V1 3D Scanner
product_meta.description: Combining superior performance with intuitive usability, the Matter and Form 3D Scanner is an affordable, high resolution 3D scanner that is compact, portable, fully assembled and easy to use right out of the box. Use your Mac or Windows PC to produce accurate, detailed color scans at resolution qualities that match or top what more expensive scanners can achieve. It works with almost any 3D printer or online printing service, and it allows users to scan solid items to create a digital 3D model. It is also capable of producing intricate, high-resolution, 3D representations. Recommended computer specs CPU: i5, RAM: 4GB
feature_bullets: Design that delivers High availability, scalability, and for maximum flexibility and price/performance
Easy to install. Operating Temperature: 15° - 32° C (60° - 90° F)
The country of Origin is China. Scan accuracy: Within ± 0.1mm
Save to multiple formats, including; STL, and point cloud; PLY for superior compatibility

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
